Package civitas.celestis.graphics.color

Class RGBColor

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.integer.IntVector3
civitas.celestis.math.natural.NaturalVector3
civitas.celestis.graphics.color.RGBColor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IntVector, NaturalVector, Numeric, Serializable
public class RGBColor extends NaturalVector3
A 8-bit color which only has discrete integer RGB components.
See Also:

      Parameters:
      hexInt - The hex code as an integer

      public RGBColor(int r, int g, int b)
      Creates a new color. All components must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:

      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color

      @Nonnull public RGBColor apply(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Integer> operator)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • proximity

      public double proximity(@Nonnull RGBColor c)
      Returns the proximity index of this color and the provided color c. This is calculated by normalizing the squared distance of the two colors.

      An index of 0 means the colors are equal, while an index of 1 means that the colors are completely different. (most likely BLACK and WHITE)

      Parameters:
      c - The color to compare to
      Returns:
      The proximity index of the two colors

    • reverse

      @Nonnull public RGBColor reverse()
      Returns the reverse of this color. The RGB components are reversed by applying 255 - value.
      Returns:
      The reverse of this color
